question_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
question_list.text:
For me, this is clearly the right shift,
The boredom-slash-wild-drunken-fight shift.
It's been called D&D
("Death and donuts," you see).
Yes, there's nothing like working the night shift.
question_list.question: What is the nickname for the night shift in a store?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Sasquatch made off with Aunt Betty,
Then yelled when she cooked him spaghetti,
"Make tracks with your damn sauce;
Us bigfeet like clam sauce!"
Now she's out in Tibet with a yeti.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The election's no longer in doubt.
The results slowly filtering out
Show the numbers are dire.
It's gone down to the wire,
But our Kingfish has fought his last bout.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You appear so impeccably dressed
That I'll have to admit I'm impressed;
Handsome tie, stylish suit,
And I also salute
You for wearing a bulletproof vest.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Made of heavy imported brocade,
Our bedcover's neatly arrayed
At the base of the bed;
We should spread it instead,
But we don't, 'cause the bed's never made!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"I can vouch for the prisoner's purity
Of character. As for security,
Five pounds is my bond,"
Lied the broomstick.  Abscond?
Yes, I will. Thank you, bail-for-fee surety!

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
If you think you have hypoglycemia,
And you're sure that it isn't anemia,
Please let me suggest
That your blood needs a test
To be sure you don't have acidaemia.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In my nautical journal I wrote:
"As I rowed I saw driftweed afloat.
As toward shore the plants drifted,
I reached down and lifted
A handful right into my boat."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There once was a fellow named Fogel
Who greatly resembled a bogle—
An ogre or demon—
A hobgoblin's he-man—
Or a guy in a story by Gogol.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A matchlock or firelock set light
To some gunpowder, putting in flight
A bullet or ball,
Efficacious though small,
From an arquebus, weapon of might.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A fly-by-night business is one
That will take all your money and run.
When you go to claim flybuys,
They're gone (said their bye-byes).
Rewards for your loyalty?  None.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
The author, in stardom delighting,
Her autonym placed on her writing.
This use of her name
Let her revel in fame
And was pleasant to use in self-citing.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If you've learned ancient Greek, do your best
To remember, when taking a test,
All its alphabet, friend,
From beginning to end:
Alpha, beta... click here for the rest.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Is she moodily beefing aloud
When she's stuck in a bullheaded crowd
That's described by a word
You've undoubtedly heard?
No, that bossy's too easily cowed.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Her chinoiserie desk doesn't fit 
In his favorite room, both admit. 
Its curlicued dragon 
About which she's braggin' 
He won't miss at all when they split.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It surprised me — I'm makin' a killin'
With pills of my fake ampicillin.
Not antibiotic —
Their effects are erotic!
Folks queue for a chance to be illin'.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said a cardsharp, "I know how you feel.
You've been robbed by an odious heel."
Then he took what was left,
Leaving Queenie bereft.
"Just another," she sighed, "dirty deal."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Me, me, me. Me, me, me. Me, me, me.
Me, me, me. Me, me, me. Me, me, me.
Me, me, me. Me, me, me.
Me, me, me. Me. Me. Me!
Me! Me! Me! ME (not you)! ME! ME! ME!!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He's aware she's the wife of the earl,
And off limits, 'twould seem, to this churl,
But he's eager to dance,
So he offers a chance
To the countess: "Let's give it a whirl!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When we call someone "Judas" we claim
He's a traitor. (They're one and the same.)
So don't let it faze ya.
In antonomasia
The class is implied by a name.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Now, I mainly eat burgers and fries,
But the moment I saw those doe eyes
(Or perhaps they were buck)
In my oncoming truck,
I thought, "Bambi and Thumper Surprise!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The word chear (obsolete) now is cheer,
Though that style looks decidedly quear.
Yet were Shakespeare still hear
Hard at work mid-carear,
I'd say, "Bill, let me buy you a bear!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Abietic's a word that applies
To a genus of trees that we prize
From a temperate clime
Bearing cones in their prime.
With their height, they're a sight fir soar eyes.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Toward the seventeenth tee I was strutting
(I had done some magnificent putting!),
When this golf cart zipped by,
And I let out a cry
Like some kid back at school, "Hey, no cutting!"

limerick_list.author: rbalexx and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Colored brindle or fawn, with white paws,
Friendly boxers are dogs with square jaws.
They've a face (what a mug!)
That resembles a pug
Who's been punched in the ring to applause.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
First a lasso he coiled (or convolved),
Then it spiraled in air—then dissolved.
It just melted away.
The magician won't say
How he did it. The problem's unsolved.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Denmark, I watch as a blonde
Eats a sundae (I'm sensing a bond).
So I ask for a bite
Of her cherry, but quite
Unimpressed, she won't Dane to respond.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
On the left is Canadian bacon.
On the right, lightly stirred but not shaken:
James Bond's favorite drink.
They're quite different, I think.
Their distinctness can not be mistaken.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I'm a birler whose skill is supreme,
Treading logs for America's team.
Though the logs bob and spin,
I just never fall in —
Help! I'm trapped in a lumberjack's dream!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A new restaurant's opened uptown
With a chef they claim cooked for the Crown.
The appointments are charming,
But the food tastes alarming.
To be trendy, I'm choking it down.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A demirep (demimondaine)
Provides service humane and profane;
Yet her half-reputation
Secures compensation:
She puts out for personal gain.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
A. abrotanum: let me make clear
That this wormwood makes worms disappear.
When prepared as a potion
For bowel commotion,
It leads to that hearty bronx cheer.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I keep searching the sweetest sweet shops
For my favorite raspberry drops.
Sucking candy's my vice
(At a sensible price)—
Not Godiva, but give 'em their props.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
If it's power you seek to attain
And excitement you're after, you'd gain
What you want by consorting
With drug kings and courting
Disaster while dealing cocaine.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
"When you start your computer, boot DOS,"
Sighed my wife, "for I don't give a toss,
But I'd not get a kick
From your joke, David." Quick
As a flash I said, "Sure you would, Dos."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
This diet book sure is a fount
Of good tips on controlling the count
Of the calories we
Consume daily.  (I see
That my intake's too vast an amount.)

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Some months after serious stress
Finds my follicles under duress.
They're in telogen phase,
And effluvium days
Lead to shedding. My hair is a mess.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
My enlarger (dichroic diffuser)
Is a spirit of light, and I use her
For sacred escapes
Out of negative shapes
Into prints; when they're through, I excuse her.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
She's an aquaphobe—scared of the water—
So won't use the bathtub I bought 'er.
That's fine, though; her reek
Makes her lose hide-and-seek—
I can smell 'er before I can spot  'er.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Pinyin j as in China's Beijing—
From what place does this consonant sing?
Q and x, the same way,
Unlike "zhay" or our "jay,"
Have alveolo-palatal sting.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
It's no wonder that bell-ringers pull,
For their lives are resoundingly full
Of loud clanging and chimes;
Come and share these good times,
Though your ears may need cotton wool.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Just seeing her gives me a thrill:
At each meeting, she's bonnier still.
She is someone so comely,
I stare at her dumbly,
Besotted, bereft of free will.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
This garden's edenic—pure bliss!
I smell flowers I just want to kiss...
And the fruit trees abound.
There is joy all around—
But it stops when I hear that low hiss.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
We've been buddies since I don't know when,
And for golf we both share the same yen.
But the friendship is off
If just once more you cough
At the top of my backswing again!

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cryotherapy? That's what you'll try,
Dr. Weepington? Please tell me why!
Though I think—am I dreaming?—
Some treatments use screaming,
This wart won't come off if I cry.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Baron Phelps behaved not as he ought,
But contemptibly, all of us thought.
He was rude, mean and cruel,
Killed a duke in a duel,
Fled to Leipzig and never was caught.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What is ducal?" asked lecturer Luke.
"It's the stuff that pertains to a duke,
Like his armor,  his bugle,
His gold (if he's frugal),
And his perfectly powdered peruke."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Any foe I am glad to anoint
With my anger by signs that are joint.
Just one finger won't do.
For my sign, I need two:
Their consignification's the point.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
Would you like to eat fat, Mr Green?
(Read again with the comma unseen.)
If you choose not to use it,
The reader will "lose it"—
That comma makes clear what you mean.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Yes,  I'm  getting a little bit dry;
Appletini's a drink I must try,
As I think I shall savor
An apple-y flavor
In vodka today to get high.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
To expediate means to make haste,
To lay each obstruction to waste,
To affirm wheels are greased,
To get hold-ups released,
To ensure as the winner you're placed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the sand, find a clamshell with edging
That's sharp, and a shape good for wedging,
On the isle of Nantucket—
It looks like the bucket
Called  clamshell that's useful for dredging.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Her beauty enhancement's as silly
As painting a rose, willy-nilly.
Her sweet features she'll cake
In thick make-up — I ache
To inform her she's gilding the lily.

limerick_list.author: David Bourke
limerick_list.text:
In Sussex, on England's south coast,
There's a place where posh residents boast.
Asked, "Is this Brighton, factually?"
They say, "No, Hove Actually!"
(A frightfully snobby riposte!)

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Offered seconds, I could have rebuffed
My good hostess, but gently I bluffed:
"Your pot pie is divine,
But no more can I dine—
I am surfeit, I'm farctate, I'm stuffed."

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
You were born years ago on this day,
With some parts you don't often display.
 So I bought a machine
 That can help keep them clean,
And it's all for you — Happy Bidet!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Auteurism doesn't concern
A trip to Vienna or Berne,
But a dominant vector—
A movie's director—
That determines the praise his films earn.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Now the weather has warmed, I admit
I'm a farmer at heart, and it's fit.
Green from brown is my thing;
I can't feel part of spring
Till my hands have been dirtied a bit.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Tipsy mathematicians contrive
To produce derivations and thrive,
Though such alcohol levels
Leave other poor devils
Unable to drink and derive.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Spend the night?" "Take the barn," said the farmer,
"But my daughter — be sure you don't harm her."
Well, his wife's been to school,
Knows the jokes, is no fool,
So the daughter wears full-body armor.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the course of kids' normal morphosis,
Each one closes his ductus arteriosus
When he starts breathing air.
It should shut then and there,
Or the infant may show cyanosis.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Every chemical process that runs
May produce goods for living or ones
That are used as a weapon
To fight those who step in
To your range of interest with guns.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
It's called brain damage! No one with brains
Would put heroin into their veins.
With your head filled with horse,
You will feel no remorse,
Only madness—insanity reigns!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
Val
limerick_list.text:
A certificate signifies to
A prospective employer you're due
For the chance of a start —
Though you know in your heart
Where you go after that's up to you.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He's below the proverbial salt.
Though he's lowly, it isn't his fault.
Still, he takes to your daughter
Like a duck does to water.
Put a stop to it, Jack. Call a halt.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
"Pay your child-support, deadbeat! You cad!"
Now my cognitive dissonance gad
Says it's in my dominion
To change my opinion.
Could my actions be really so bad?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said a slow ER tech, name of Wyatt,
"Busy workload? I'd rather not try it.
Manic shifts don't endear.
I prefer it right here:
"Feet-up General" — it's peaceful and quiet.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the caves of Ajanta, I start
A foray into Buddhism's heart.
There are paintings in halls
That World Heritage calls
"Universal pictorial art."

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The word baby: I'm sure you're aware it
Suggests "small."  Take the term baby carrot:
It's a tinier brand
Of that vegetable, and
It's decidedly harder to share it.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
To define balanced prime, folks, you know,
Take both next prime above and below.
If their average you see
Is the prime's equal, we
Have achieved our intent — there you go!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This tenor role's saved for the star men.
Don José falls in love, joins bizarre men,
As an army deserter.
His lover's a flirter;
Her murder's the ending of Carmen.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Just imagine his state of chagrin
When he found out why he couldn't win.
He had rhymed star with war
And the judges all swore
'Twas an entry they wouldn't let in.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As he worked on his puzzle (acrostic),
He said, "Damn it, these words make my jaw stick!"
She looked at him fox-eyed—
"Drink sodium hydroxide!"
Do you think her response was too caustic?

limerick_list.author: Kim Le
limerick_list.text:
Antisexual's where I am at
Since my lover and I had a spat.
My affections withholding,
No way am I folding!
It's my way, or sleep with the cat.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
If word choices cause you frustration,
Be tricky and try affixation.
From store, get restore,
Storage, storing, and more —
Like substoral, my latest creation.

limerick_list.author: LMAK
limerick_list.text:
Biodiversity gives us the means
To quantify species and genes,
Circumscribe populations'
Ecosystem foundations—
Its importance ain't just for the greens!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Said the eyewitness, high on the face,
And her partner, around the same place:
We've been watching the nose
And the hand come to blows.
Did we see any blood? Not a trace.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Small brass buttons — do flowers get lowlier?
Can't stand hills. Loving land that is bowly-er,
Salty wetlands they settle.
They haven't one petal.
They're  Cotula coronopifolia.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The lord's at their table, and eats
With the tenants, enjoying the treats.
This is coshery—tense,
Since who foots the expense?
The dependents who furnish the seats.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When his girl starts to scream and talk dirty,
He's put right off his stride, and gets shirty.
Ron's a sensitive guy,
And he fails to see why
She finds yelling rude words fun and flirty.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Two braggarts decided to vie
In a contest of boasting—no lie.
"I will crush you amigo,
You can't touch my ego,
Let's launch this debate I to I."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Set off by a cross, by decree,
Is the long Christcross-row, A to z,
Then an alphabet stew
Of "ba, be, bi, bo, bu,
Ab, eb, ib" ... an example or three.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She'll spend May in Nepal (Katmandu
Is a springtime delight, it is true)
Where the phone service stinks.
She has checked it and thinks
If you call her, you'll never get through.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
An old rubber band will go wacky;
All brittle and sticky or tacky.
But what will protect
It before it gets wrecked?
Antiozonants do it, by cracky!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Once the lad she'd been eyeing matured,
Connie planned his seduction: she lured
Vin away from his bike,
Saying, "This, you will like."
The convincement of Vince was assured.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
The bones we have (more when we're born)
Are the frame that our muscles adorn.
Head connects to the neck,
Neck connects to the—heck,
You should know all the rest, so well-worn.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
"I would fain lead my men into war,"
Said the admiral. "Sadly, no more
Am I able to fight;
I retired last night,
Or I'd willingly sail from this shore."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
He slides out of his gallon jug snakery
In the dark of the night: black snake fakery.
But my Gram, bathroom bound,
Treads his tail.  Wails redound.
Grandfolks race from black racer to bakery.

limerick_list.author: Screenhog
limerick_list.text:
There once was a JPEG I tweeted;
It now sits on my desktop, unneeded.
And so, with a click
And a drag of that pic,
It goes into the Trash Bin — deleted.

limerick_list.author: c_tennety
limerick_list.text:
My wife heard me mention an ore:
"'Biotitic,' you called her!" she swore.
Her virulent burst—
And this isn't her first—
Upon mica, I strongly deplore.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Ray's amazed by dear Maisie's maize maze.
He turned left, doubled right, hopes ablaze.
Now confusion is winning—
His head's madly spinning—
He's been lost, lacking reason, for days.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There are acuate leaves on this plant;
They're so pointy our landscaper can't
Be persuaded to trim it.
He's putting a limit
On work for today, and it's scant.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
In the back of the house, where we work,
It will frequently look like the Cirque
Du Soleil.  It's intense;
Night and day you will sense
That our restaurant kitchen's berserk.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"I know more than the generals do!"
Said "The Donald" when asked for his view
Of the Middle East crisis
And the scourge known as ISIS.
He's his own field commander. Who knew?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Dustin Diamond, on Saved by the Bell
And two spinoffs, played "Screech" for a spell.
A lot smaller his wage,
He then took to the stage
Doing standup (pure comedy hell).

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Charlie Chaplin's an actor of fame
From the silent film era. He came
To do "talkies" much later,
But as mime, he was greater.
He puts modern acting to shame.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
You afflict, you torment, and you drecche,
And you dræcche and you dracche me, you wretch.
When you dreeche in your sleep,
Then my temper I'll keep,
Or I might be sent down for a stretch.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Red Shiraz was about to progress
Down her ivory evening dress.
I cried, "Hey, watch that wine!"
"Lap's protected, I'm fine —
Dinner napkins prevent mess and stress."

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
In more erudite scripts from the past,
There was badinage too good to last.
Now the actors explode
Like some stopped-up commode
And make films that I wish I had passed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Mindless tasks, which I'm sinking beneath,
Wrap their fronds round my neck like a wreath.
I'm so chocker (browned-off—
Bored to tears, in a trough
Of ennui—and fed up to the teeth).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When his parents were glad to announce
He's a healthy ten-pound seven-ounce
Chubby bouncing young baby,
His brothers thought maybe
They'd find out how high he could bounce.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
With computers, a benchmark will show
If a system is running too slow.
The time that it takes
Is the measure it makes
When it's running some tasks that you know.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
When the parish finds out it will shock 'em.
They'll insist that the Bishop defrock him.
How could one they so trust
Use their children with lust?
Cucullus non facit monachum.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
A bdelloid once played the big screen,
Grabbed a role in the African Queen;
Except that we hate,
Just like Bogie and Kate,
The leech who must share our big scene.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A furry young bear cub took fright
Coming home with his family one night:
"My porridge was eaten!
They've broken my seat, 'n
They're still in my bed that's just right!"

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm a finalist waiting for news;
Is it me whom the judges will choose?
Brutal contest, last heat —
Am I out in the street?
 Well, at least it's my last chance to lose.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The view from the tower enthused me,
But the head of the stairway confused me.
I misstepped at the top,
Tripped and fell, and the drop—
I went ass over teakettle—bruised me.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
As a babe, I was brought by my aunt
To the church, where she told them: "I want
A ritual sprinkling,
And I have an inkling
You'll need a baptismal stone font."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
An old lady committed a crime;
She got caught and was forced to do time.
As I said, there's a gammer
Got tossed in the slammer.
The End. (So, no need for a rhyme.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Six elephant ears were a treat.
Flat, fried dough that is sugary sweet
Was too good to pass by
At that street fair.  From my
Dietitian I'm taking some heat.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
There's an old Russian witch, Baba Yaga,
Whose tale is a spine-chilling saga.
Her hair's made of wire,
And her glare burns like fire,
And her hide's tough and brown as a Nauga.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
"My wife is a ravishing dame,"
At best, is a challengeable claim.
Reflecting on this,
I choose marital bliss
And accept it as is all the same.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Where an all-moving surface, i.e.
On an aircraft, moves singly and free
Of other parts in,
Say, a rudder or fin,
It has that designation. You see?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Down from eight bucks to five, and now three,
T-bone steaks are as cheap as can be.
Falls in prices may mean
Less than gourmet cuisine.
Still, it's better than Chef Boyardee.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Alameda: a walkway with trees.
It's where folks in the town shoot the breeze,
Where mothers can stroll
While their offspring cajole,
And where teens are transmitting disease.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is true that I hadn't a clue
Why McHugh was lethargic and blue.
He was feverish, too;
My anxiety grew
Till I learned he'd come down with the flu.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The destruction from drugs—nothing new.
Is there anything more we can do?
We support drug enforcement—
Award our endorsement,
But I often feel helpless; don't you?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Hateful councillor! Oh, I could weep!
He will even take bribes in his sleep.
He's as bent as a nine
Bob note. He's a swine.
So corrupt! So dishonest, that creep!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
To Pliny the Elder, 'twas clear
How an ostrich reacted to fear.
But that sensible bird,
Thinking Pliny absurd,
With a blink made the sage  disappear.

limerick_list.author: chakaal
limerick_list.text:
So many tacticians patrician
Pursued this great Roman tradition:
The Sequani shattered,
Helvetii battered,
And Belgae worn down by attrition.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
A persistent demandress, my Tess —
She required an answer, no less.
She insisted I tell 'er
(I'm now 'er ex-feller)
"Is my bum getting big?" — I said yes.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Diplosomia: Siamese sibs
Who, conjoined, don't use separate cribs.
Now these partners have plighted
Their kin-dom united —
David (Tory) and Nick (for Dem-Libs).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Every spoonful of barley's a chiller;
Each bowlful of bran is a thriller.
We're spinning a story,
Both corny and gory,
Of Muesli, the cereal killer.

limerick_list.author: yoyology
limerick_list.text:
In Obeah (Caribbean lore)
It's the  duppy all people abhor.
Evil spirits like that
Make you hot-foot it, stat,
To a shaman who'll tell you the score!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"Your projector might fail," warned the geek,
"So be chary, preparing to speak."
"Before giving my talk,
I could check on the chalk,"
Chuckled Chuck, who was chock full of cheek.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My seagoing friend sent a note.
"My new sailboat is cat-rigged," he wrote,
"It has only one sail
(But it's too strong to fail),
And the mast's in the front of the boat."

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Fruity yogurt is really delicious.
Homemade ice cream is too! Feel ambitious?
Try making some cheese.
Made with milk, all of these
Dairy products are very nutritious!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Johann Bach calls today. What a loon!
Says he's written some dumb fugue'n tune.
With me snoot full of smack,
I says, "Bach, call you back."
So I got back to Bach just past noon.

limerick_list.author: LoudNotes
limerick_list.text:
"Quite a few" is well known as a lot,
Oft misspelled as one word though it's not.
Alot is an error
That's not getting rarer
And may need its own OEDILF slot.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
For helping with loans at the bank,
There's a staffer I really should thank.
But I just can't recall
What his name is at all.
How I strain when my brain draws a blank.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
She's a chronic complainer: she'll whine,
No matter the place that we dine—
If her soup is too hot
Or her spoon has a spot
Or her coleslaw is shredded too fine.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's authentic and wondrously made,
But there's cankerfret: copper's decayed.
Arm & Hammer could clean
What's not meant to be green,
Although maybe you're fond of that shade.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A good earwigging, that's what they needed,
As the march towards the voting proceeded.
Private talks are routine
On the get-a-vote scene,
But this time that talk's not succeeded.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
My sleeplessness wasn't comedic.
The doctor, a staunch Ayurvedic,
Said, "The cure in this matter
Is light, crispy batter."
Now my mattress is tempura-pedic.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Ask me A, ask me B, C, and then
Ask me A, B and C once again!
Your Qs, I have found,
Cover much the same ground.
Write my answers down! Borrow my pen!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
We shall fight in the streets, on the shores.
We shall never surrender.  For wars
We engage in with nations,
We've fortifications
Outside of our towns (our dehors).

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I stayed up very late in the night.
With sleep, I gave up — lost the fight.
Yes, sleep got my number;
I sure needed slumber  —
Like that, I went out like a light.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Caloricity's why, I'm surmising,
I'm flushed and my temperature's rising.
It's the opposite sex
That provokes these effects.
We're animals — what's so surprising?

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Consider prez hopeful John Kerry, who
Announced while campaigning, "We'll bury you!"
He refused to recant
His Khrushchevian rant....
Oh, limerick?  I thought you said clerihew.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
When in astrapophobia's grip,
You might quake at a rainstorm's first drip,
For the lightning you fear
Is most certainly near.
You had better go cancel your trip.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When I'm speaking impromptu, it's tough
To remember the relevant stuff.
Jotted crib notes I leave
On the end of my sleeve,
So I speak off the cuff, off my cuff.

limerick_list.author: Nathan Howe
limerick_list.text:
Ditheistical people construe
That instead of one God, there are two.
If your soul's dualistic,
Become ditheistic.
Is the ditheist thing you can do.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
When our clergyman, Reverend Gray,
Felt compelled in his sermon to say
God had told him that prayer
Was just so much hot air,
He was spirited swiftly away.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
At dawning, I yawn and awaken.
From that smell, I can tell what you're makin'.
Setting fire to the lard
Renders thoroughly charred,
Indigestible messes of bacon.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your sense of decorum was dashed
When a moth crawled from out your mustache.
As you bowed to the Queen,
Your discomfort was keen.
What you felt at the time was abashed.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
I gave you permission to write,
For I knew it would bring me delight;
But your voice is so shrill,
Like a dentist's new drill—
No one authorized you to recite!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Here's the skull of a man. I feel awed.
It's not dull. See? The cranium's broad,
While the face is so narrow
It looks like a sparrow.
Cryptozygous, it's normal, not flawed.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I anticipate, often with dread,
Armageddon and being quite dead.
But it should be dramatic
To watch from the attic.
Perhaps I'll be safe in my bed.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
Brand of many a household appliance,
And commune of great self-reliance
That was founded by Germans
With positive sermons:
Amana—both social and science.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In college, when nature would storm,
Kate watched thunderbolts, studied their form.
She'd predict, from the lightning,
Dire prophesies frightening—
The demise of each girl in the dorm.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Tommy gave the lieutenant a slap,
Shouting, "Sweetie, you gave me the clap!"
Sarge said, "That's his finale
In Deolali. Bally
Sod's mad, got the doolally tap."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
As marsupial genus names go,
I'd say Chaeropus ranks rather low.
There's more obvious shame
In the popular name
Of the pig-footed bandicoot, though.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I have updated A, and want B,
But I'm waiting for B to be free;
B is locked 'til the day
You get access to A…
It's a deadly embrace, as you see.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Please do not say that bodies I "snatch";
I just harvest the dead in that patch.
I'm a born resurrectionist —
Ghoulish perfectionist.
Corpse-farming cunning comes natch.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Said a man who was easy to diss,
"I concede that my breath smells like piss,
And it's true that my mama
Has a face like a llama,
But too gracious?  I take this amiss!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My energy drops by a half,
So they order a cardiograph,
Find the walls of my ticker
Are thicker (I'm sicker),
Then call in the surgical staff.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
All our trophies and talents we lay
At Your feet, Lord, to use as You may,
That the world worship, kneeling,
Your glory's revealing:
Maiorem ad gloriam Dei.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
"Some errors," said Pete, "are quite stark.
Writing it's (meaning its) — well now, hark —
The apostrophe's place
In the genitive case
Is for nouns; don't give pronouns this mark."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I profess no particular creed.
I'm an anythingarian.  Feed
Me the dogma you hold,
And I won't fit that mold.
There's no one true religion I heed.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Can an anode and cathode be friends?
Who's in charge when their sparks fly? Depends.
Are these opposites wracked
When they learn they attract?
Are they shocked when their passion transcends?

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Not a polyglot? Rot! Ballyhoo!
Like a native I speak parley-voo.
As I jamais was truant
In French class, I'm fluent.
See, I say "Je suis Charlie", too.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A time, institution, or place
May sometimes be able to trace
The source of its name
To achievements or fame
Of an eponym — one they embrace.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Cracker bonbons in bright paper wrap
Can be shared by a pair, with a snap!
Winner finds in the middle
A hat, gift, and riddle
Or joke he won't care to recap.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In the desert, an afternoon tea
Is served poshly by camels at three.
There the Bactrian crew
Offers, "One hump or two?
Would you care for some French patisserie?"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
There's Becky from Vanity Fair,
And that head-turner played by Ms. Blair;
Then there's Varla and Kate
(Who was tamed, but too late):
Antiheroines all, I declare.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Intellectuals surely took note
Of the essays that Emerson wrote:
Truth's not doctrine-dependent,
But simple, transcendent —
Intuitive — never remote.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A mob runs out the door at full speed.
(A mad shriek had set off a stampede—
A mouse squeaked at some dame
And mass exodus came.)
Will chaos ensue? Guaranteed.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
English Lit: an assignment, dismay!
Take the Bard, make him curt, choose a play.
On my paper, reviewed:
"Insufficiently rude!"
So I'll brusque up my Shakespeare today.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Adorable?  Maybe you are,
But you're also too cutesy by far.
It's a saccharine show;
Better pack it and go,
'Cause I'm getting the feathers and tar.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When you crawl in that bedroll, beware
Of the vaunted nocturnal corsair.
This reduviid bug
Is a bloodsucking thug,
With a bite that brings pain and despair.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Use some eyeliner, lipstick, and base
To improve your appearance in case
You've the hots for that guy.
You will best catch his eye
With cosmetics.  Go fix up your face.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'll be dropping you near the North Pole;
About five degrees off is my goal.
Gonna let that colatitude
Fix your damn attitude,
Now that you're out on parole.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Said Anne Bradstreet, a poet from Mass.,
Of her verses, "I've far too much class
To brag or to boast,
Though you must admit most
Will kick Emily Dickinson's ass."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Two great movies they're showing today
At the Bijou — let's go right away!
"Double Feature — One Buck!"
OMG, we're in luck:
Lusty Ladies and Virgins at Play.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
When a poet grew pot quite sublime
For compassionate use, in Nanaim-
o, son Sasha, a nurse,
Stole his cash, stash and verse.
(Note to self: rhyme 'Nantucket' next time.)

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Ailurophobia means "fearing  cats":
Could be lions, or tigers—not bats.
It may be a Persian,
Or some other version
Of  creatures they say sat on mats.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A lesson in bowling begins:
"The count is the number of pins
You knock down in a frame.
At the end of the game,
If you're six down, a seven-count wins."

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
In the alphabet, numbered at three,
Or as water, to windward or lee,
Like an 'O' that's unfurled
Till it's sickle-shaped, curled:
Do you see, is it sea or just C?

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
In the singular, crincum's a turn
Or a twist or a bend, but we learn
If you got the French pox
From that syph-spreading fox
You can say it's the crincums that burn.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Couvade leaves me shocked, yet beguiled:
There's a husband whose wife bears a child.
He's in bed, where his screams
Mimic labor, it seems,
Reenacting the call of the wild.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A competitor sometimes resorts
To unscrupulous wiles of all sorts,
For defeating one's rival
Is key to survival
In politics, business, and sports.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The devil invented a bell
That would ring with each lie that I'd tell.
It rang twelve times a day.
Now I'm dead—passed away—
It's the chime on my cell phone in Hell.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Yellow blooms, with your delicate shape,
Yielding oil from your seed, like the grape:
Why the name of canola?
Is it just to console a
Consumer who's frightened of rape?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
If your strategy's holding a place
At the table to meet face to face,
You must make contributions
That offer solutions,
Constructively making your case.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In demurrage, not back on the road,
I'm detained: took too long to unload—
What the carriage authorities
Call breach of priorities.
What a crock! They can watch me implode.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Pinkish-white, red at night, what I'm spottin'
Are blooms that, once seen, aren't forgotten.
These hibiscuses grow
In the South—what a show!
To Confederate roses I cotton!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Said the prince's physician, "Your Highness's
Brain has its pluses and minuses.
Yes, it's healthy and sound,
But some bats have been found
Flying round in your confluence of sinuses."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Bond ratings are under assault
As the bonds turn to dross in our vault,
And we've something to say
To the people who weigh
Up the chances that they will default.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
How you crank up a mob's indignation!
You bring havoc and mass devastation.
You incite them to riot —
God damn you, be quiet!
The name of your game's fomentation.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A HazMat retiree named Gene
Took to cookery: Tex-Mex cuisine.
But to him what appeals
Are leguminous meals;
In the end, he's become a Haz-bean.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
But Don John's a malevolent foe:
He's a back-stabbing traitor, and so
He says Claudio's tricked,
And Don Pedro has picked
That young maid for himself. Oh, the woe!

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Trying peace now when push comes to shove,
Here's an olive branch, also a dove.
Anger's peaked, let's just scratch it—
Let's bury the hatchet!
Enough beef, sweetie—wanna make love?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's a rice bran that groceries stock
In Manila, but not round the clock.
Folks who want to ensure
Their supplies are secure
Every day get a piece of darak.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
In an aqueduct water flows down
From its source, through a pipe, to a town
Atop aqueduct bridges
That arch between ridges
And keep the pipe up off the groun'.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Though I've placed us, I think, on my map,
There's a wide curiosity gap
Between factors I'm sure of
And some I'll want more of.
I'm a painstaking sort of a chap.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I invented a gizmo that beeps
When it senses the presence of creeps.
It can tell if you're here
To get laid, disappear,
And not stay to get married for keeps.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
When an army comes barreling through,
Their provisions they'll have to renew.
So they just dispurvey
You of yours without pay,
And there isn't too much you can do.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
You complain that you're bored, and you frown?
Do whatever you want! Party down!
I am setting you free
To go out on a spree;
You've been given free rein; go to town!

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
I'm growing a Barberton daisy
(Inside, not the garden—I'm lazy).
In these gerberas' case
The Transvaal was their base;
Now they've scattered all over, like crazy.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Our old friend is from Árainn, a Celt.
Inis Mór is the home where she's dwelt
Knitting jumpers, her trade,
Sold to Brits who invade
From the mainland when winter snows melt.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
When our priest, a fine singer's descanting,
His 4ths, 5ths, and 6ths leave me panting.
I hold dear and revere
Every clear, defined tier.
Use your ear, can't you hear, he's in chanting!

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
When a maximum dose you exceed,
And you start to regret your misdeed,
Before breathing your last,
Get to hospital fast,
Where it's emetine, stat, that you need.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Do you live in a desert of dread? Do
You long for oases instead? Do
You pray for a harem
To play harum scarum
And do in your bed as the Bedu?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"He's got carbuncles," said my aunt Em,
"And he's eager to get rid of them."
I was ready to bid
When Aunt Emily chid,
"Dear, a carbuncle isn't a gem!"

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
An immense croquembouche he erected
On a day fifty guests were expected.
Pâte à choux in a tower
Took many an hour—
The pastry chef's talent perfected.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
The man with the raggedy coat
Was constantly clearing his throat.
He was smelly and rough,
Evil-tempered and gruff.
He was caprine — that's "just like a goat".

limerick_list.author: Jim Macaulay
limerick_list.text:
Bully critics are those who will draw
Stringent judgments that cut like a saw.
Those who give the best jeers
Of their lives to draw tears
Are renowned to be quick on the flaw.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To emolliate, make someone weak,
Irresolute, feeble, and meek.
Though your victim may be male,
He'll turn rather female,
But not very sexy or chic.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm told clicktivism lets you protest
Without even the need to get dressed.
Sign an online petition
To state your position,
And that's it? I am less than impressed!

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
An eight-legged spider said, "Geez!
(And my six-legged friend here agrees.)
We find it so comic
That parts anatomic
Are singles and pairs, never threes."

limerick_list.author: Rose
limerick_list.text:
"I don't like the river, that's that-o.
Rowing isn't for me." But said Rat, "Oh!
Mole! Don't be a whiner —
There's no pleasure finer
Than messing about in a bateau!"

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
My mother was stricken with sorrow:
"It's sad how you scrounge and you borrow!
Will you, please, pay your debt!"
But I grinned, "Mum, don't fret!
I'll get 'round to it—maybe tomorrow."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Brother Bryce, if you'll take my advice,
You'll get rid of Ms Weiss.  She's not nice.
You approach her with boldness;
She counters with coldness.
Folks call her the "Princess of Ice."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A CAT scanner slices and dices
Your innards—these magic devices
Use X-rays to see
Your insides in 3-D—
While a cat scanner's useful for mices.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Some rain and some dirt create mud
And a torrent produces a flood,
But I never have known
To have turned up a stone
Or a turnip that generates blood.

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
If you hate when you're asked "What's your age?",
There's a way to respond that's the rage.
A biennium's years
Cut in half what one hears;
The result's not as easy to gauge.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I grew ill while proposing to Julie;
She laughed at my plight quite unduly.
She said no and then split
With the diamond. Yes, it
Was a chapter of accidents, truly!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My historical novel abounds
In gadzookery, true, on the grounds
It adds realness to plots
When my speakers use lots
Of expressions like "prithee" and "zounds!"

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Black hat hackers break in to do harm.
White hat hackers may sound the alarm.
Grey hat hackers, they say,
Can go any which way —
Neither evil, nor good. That's their charm.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Here we welcome the smart and the rich:
Come to Guernsey, a tax haven niche,
Where the webcode, gg,
Sounds like horsey to me,
And our brown and white cows look so kitsch.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
First, a melody cheesy and snappy,
Then some shots of her friends looking happy.
Random black guy for cred,
Her expressionless head...
And the end result? Totally crappy.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's the part that is central or main
Of a thing to which others pertain.
And the parts that attach
Or sit round it? No match.
It's the body that's destined to reign.

limerick_list.author: suelin
limerick_list.text:
Vaccines put our stomachs in knots.
On occasion, we'll suddenly plotz.
So it never attracts us
To anaphylaxis:
Induction by needles and shots.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"You tell me your trousers feel roomy, a-
typically so.  So you'll sue me, eh?
If not, stop your yammer.
Your vids, Mr Hammer,
Need drama.  Please trust your costumier."

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A cudgel, or maybe a hook,
Was as "dogs," in translation, mistook.
Now this heavenly pair
Ever hunt the Great Bear.
It's Canes Venatici—look!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
Giri
limerick_list.text:
I'm beginning to learn a few tricks
Of writing a limerick that ticks,
One with humour and sense
And lines not quite so dense—
Of metre and rhyme a fine mix.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Montgomery County, the council
Is pulling its weight—every ounce'll
Be used to enact
Legislation we've lacked
To eradicate weeds like the groundsel.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Said the Pharaoh, addressing the Sphinx:
"You're a real screwed-up idol, methinx.
Your creator was tryin'
To meld ram with lion,
But as a designer, he stinx."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I'm expecting a federal grant
For the play that I wrote," says my aunt,
But I've reached the conclusion
That her hope's an illusion;
That poor lady I must disenchant.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Searching nightly the net, dirty Bert, you'll
Seek girls who are willing to flirt. You'll
Pop questions online—
"Are you, cyberbabe, mine?"
Is your love the real thing, or lust virtual?

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Nate and Ann on the loveseat were lolling,
When she felt herself slipping and falling
And reached round his neck.
Drawing close at her beck,
Nate embraced her:  the lovers were colling.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
So, you're starting a Catholic sect?
If you're looking for papal respect,
  You might want to rethink
  Robes of fuchsia and pink
As the items in which you're bedecked.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Liability's proven, My Lord,
And it's criminal, so I'll record
That the culpable deed
Is... Your Lordship smokes weed!
No surprise that your summing-up's flawed!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You've left cumulative trash on my deck
In a cumulative heap.  What a wreck!
And your cumulative stares
That convey: "Heck! Who cares?"
Are a cumulative pain in the neck.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
She's been out for a night on the tiles;
Staggers home, sees the phone, and drunk dials—
"You can keep your damned bitch,
But I'll sue, and be rich.
And your 'son'? Well, here's news, hon. He's Lyall's."

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
His Tierleben (Animals' Life)
Taught the world about animals' strife
And their habits as such,
In six volumes. (That much!)
Alfred Brehm's grasp of creatures was rife.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
There once was a fellow named Derek
Who was, technically speaking, a cleric.
This fossarian (fossor)
Worked hard, the poor tosser.
A gravedigger's life is barbaric.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
A bergschrund's a glacial crevasse
Which occurs near the head of the mass
Of packed ice.  It's a wide,
Deeply plunging divide,
In a dangerous, icy morass.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
In baseball there's nothing so great
As the feeling of stealing home plate.
When you do it though, Jack,
Keep an eye on your back,
Lest the catcher be somewhat irate.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm a patriot, true, as a rule,
But then Flag Day I don't find that cool.
June 14th every year
(Without presents, I fear),
We must still go to work or to school.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Dental calculus: math for the smarter
Of dentists?" inquired Doctor Carter.
"No, it's found in the plaque
From a microbe attack;
It's the gunk on your teeth that's called tartar."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Pythagoras said (and I quote):
"Abstain from all beans." You will note
That while farting's a curse,
What he warns of is worse:
In a nutshell, he's saying, "Don't vote!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jean-Pierre made Cassandra complete
So they wed in a sweet French retreat.
But J.P. was a guy
With a wandering eye,
And this flaw broke their union tout de suite.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
When soft rock bored some people to tears,
BTO came along, shifting gears
Into overdrive.  Bachman
And Turner, two rock men,
And band brought some joy to the ears.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The soles of my shoes are embossed
With a pattern like crystals of frost.
So, please look where it's sandy
For footprints — most handy
To follow if ever I'm lost.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
A folly's a building that's odd,
Maybe costly, or even a fraud.
Take the Tattingstone Wonder:
Three cottages under
The sham of a churchly façade.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
Spoiled rotten from birth he has been;
His behavior's a cause of chagrin.
And the problem is that
When he acts like a brat
He soon finds that his welcome wears thin.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When your osteal problems are numerous,
But none is malignantly tumorous,
The docs like to rib ya
With jokes on the tibia.
(Bone mots, I suppose, can be humerus.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His interest, he said, was artistic,
But in fact it turned out fetishistic.
What's it like to discover
Of my feet he's a lover?
Well, I howled and I wailed—went ballistic.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Now, awlwort's a small water plant.
Its blossoms are sure to enchant.
Its family is mustard.
Its leaves are all clustered
And awl-shaped (I'm told by my aunt).

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
